hero.title: SELF ASSESSMENT
hero.text: Spend a few minutes to learn more about your potential alcohol or substance addiction through our assessment.

aboutAssessment.title: What is this Assessment about?
aboutAssessment.text: This assessment is a modified version of the Alcohol, Smoking and Substance Involvement Screening Test (ASSIST) which was developed by the World Health Organization. It takes approximately 5-10 minutes to complete and helps identify the risks associated with substance use. The personalised feedback helps you explore options for change.

aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.text1: The development of this website is supported and undertaken by Rajagiri College of Social Sciences (Autonomous) Centre for Excellence in Substance Use Prevention (CESUP)
aboutUs.text2: Rajagiri - COMmunity Based Action for Drug PrevenTion (R-COMBAT)

userDetails.placeOfResidence: Where is your place of residence?
userDetails.economicStatus: What is your current economic status?
userDetails.employmentStatus: How are you mainly employed at the moment?

advice.title: What's next?
advice.text: Thanks for completing the questions. Click each section below to view further information and advice.

thankYou.title: Assessment Final Scores
thankYou.text: Thank you for completing the questions. Based on your answers, you are not at any risk of harms from Tobacco, Alcohol, Cannabis, Cocaine, Inhalants, Hallucinogens, Sedatives, Opioids, Other use at this time.

footer.text: Designed & Developed by Nikhil & Sweaba at RCSS.

infoCard.text1: The eASSIST is an electronic version of the Alcohol, Smoking and Substance Involvement Screening Test (ASSIST) which was developed by the World Health Organization. The ASSIST has eight questions and takes approximately 5-10 minutes to complete. The ASSIST helps identify the risks associated with substance use and the personalised feedback helps explore options for change.

alert.answerAllQuestions: Please answer all questions to continue.
alert.ageGreaterThan18: Please enter an age greater than 18.
